text: ETV+ is a Russian language free-to-air television channel operated by the Estonian Public Broadcasting. It was launched on 28 September 2015. The channel is aimed at the Estonia's Russian-speaking minority airing both news and entertainment shows. The ETV+ name was chosen out of 360 submissions in a competition to find a name for the new channel. According to ETV+ chief Darja Saar, the plus part of the name stems from the Russian words: 'п - популярное', 'лю - любимое' and 'с - своё' meaning 'popular', 'beloved' and 'ours' which together spell plus". ==References== ==External links== * Category:Television channels in Estonia Category:Television channels and stations established in 2015 Category:Mass media in Tallinn Category:Eesti Rahvusringhääling Category:2015 establishments in Estonia Category:Russian- language mass media in Estonia
title: ETV+
